channel.title: Help on functions
channel.description:
I would like to know what a function is made of. I have read an entire lot of the TUT's and well I havne't learned anything because they all jus tell you what to put in your script I am not being mean to the people who made the TUT's I am just saying that I don't understand. So please help me.
!TheNewGuy!

item.title: Help on functions
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

a Function is a procedure which returns a value.
It is used the same was as a Procedure, in which how you you know, like err, Call it?

But in the function, There is a variable called Result which you don’t declare in the function or script but that is the value it returns.

Here are some example functions.

[code]function TimesTen(What: Integer): Integer;
begin
Result := What * 10;
end;

function FindColorIsMainScreen(Color: Integer): Boolean;
var
X, Y: Integer;
begin
Result := FindColor(X, Y, Color, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2); //Since FindColor is a boolean
end;

begin
if FindColor(0) then
Writeln(IntToStr(TimesTen(5))); //IntToStr is a function, It returns an Integer.
end.[/code]

Read full topic
